article.title: The VLA Nascent Disk And Multiplicity Survey of Perseus Protostars (VANDAM). III. Extended Radio Emission from Protostars in Perseus

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of emission is likely indicated by the steep spectral index observed in the northern outflow of Per-emb-36?
What is the approximate extent of the extended radio jet observed in SVS 13C?
What characteristic of the observed H2, radio, and HCO+ outflow towards Per-emb-30 makes it interesting?
choices: It exhibits a highly clumpy structure.
It displays a strong negative spectral index throughout.

multiple_choice_question.text: In Per-emb-33, which component dominates the emission in the C-band observations?
The spectral index northeast of L1448 IRS3A is measured to be -0.61 ± 0.24. What does this suggest about the nature of the emission?
choices: It is definitively produced by thermal free-free emission.
It is likely produced by synchrotron emission, but further investigation is needed.
It originates from the ionized outflow cavity walls.
It is contaminated by dust emission.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the likely explanation for the misaligned radio emission relative to the CO outflow in Per-emb-8?
choices: The radio emission tracing an ionized outflow cavity or disk surface.
Inaccurate measurements of the outflow direction.

multiple_choice_question.text: What causes the steep negative spectral index observed in the southern outflow of Per-emb-18?
choices: A lack of detected emission at 4.1 cm where extended 6.4 cm emission is present.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the spectral index measured in the central part of Per-emb-20?
Which protostar with resolved jets has the lowest bolometric temperature (Tbol)?
Which protostar shows the highest integrated flux density (Fν,int) at 6.4 cm?
Which protostar shows the most negative spectral index in outflow 1?
